ygData.subject: Re: Bard kiting
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Snicker Furfoot, Esq.  To:  Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 9:54 AM Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard kiting ...
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: Snicker Furfoot, Esq. <snicker@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 9:54 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard kiting


> From: "Snicker Furfoot, Esq." <snicker@...>
>
> At 09:45 AM 8/27/99 -0700, you wrote:
> >
> >Ok, we're wandering again (and I've been one of the worst offenders).
I've
> >alway pointed out to people that bard kiting requires the mob to be in
> >bellow
> >range, and that is short enough to A. Keep it from dumping on somebody,
> >and B. be a decent bit of risk. Still tedious as anything though :)
> >
> >I just dumped EQ_shamans because the whining over there was irking
> >me so much that my aggravation spilled over here. My fault, sorry.
> >
> >On bard related issues, if they did the same thing you suggest to our
damage
> >songs, how much use would they be in a group?
>
> If your group is able to deal with multiple deep reds to the point where
> Chords (or Denon's) is a primary song, perhaps we need to re-examine your
> methods. Both Chords and Denon's should be wonderful for white/black and
> below, and somewhat useful vs. yellow. But to allow one song to equally
> effect multiple reds is a tad ... overkill.
>

Err, you're right. I was trying to make an analogy to another class that
is heavily dependent on their dot's, and already not the most group oriented
class. Necros aren't bringing much to the party to start with, make it too
tough for them to stick a dot and .... ?

Actually, I'd imagine that, if your party has multiple wht/blk + mobs on it,
and
your trying to use CoD or DDD, then you're on the way to corpse recovery :)


> Talies
